p: The presence of the cap ensures stability of the transcript against a variety of cellular 5′–3′ exonucleases and recognition of the mRNA by the ribosomal protein eIF4E for efficient translation. The capping was also shown to be involved in other cellular processes such as RNA splicing and export ( Darnell, 1979, Filipowicz et al., 1976, Schibler and Perry, 1977).
